alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 27 at 6:52AM EDT until June 28 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 5.9 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.0 feet on 06/22/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (8 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 4.1 Tue 5 am 5.5 4.7 5.9 8pm 6/27 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening by 700 PM EDT.
